Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi

Class EnvEntry

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi.EnvEntry
All Implemented Interfaces:
Injectable
public final class EnvEntry extends Object implements Injectable
An environment entry in a web application. This is a simple named value that provides configuration information to the web application. It is bound to a JNDI naming tree.
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Constructor Details

    • EnvEntry

      public EnvEntry()

  • Method Details

    • setDescription

      public void setDescription(String description)
      Sets a description of this environment entry. Corresponds to the description element within env-entry in the deployment descriptor.
      Parameters:
      description - a textual description of this environment entry
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.1: Environment Entries

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Returns the description of this environment entry.
      Returns:
      the description, or null if not set

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of this environment entry. Corresponds to the env-entry-name element in the deployment descriptor.

      The name is relative to the java:comp/env context. For example, a name of myConfig would be accessible as java:comp/env/myConfig.

      Parameters:
      name - the environment entry name
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.1: Environment Entries

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of this environment entry.
      Returns:
      the environment entry name

    • setClassName

      public void setClassName(String className)
      Sets the fully-qualified Java type of this environment entry's value. Corresponds to the env-entry-type element in the deployment descriptor.

      The following types are supported: java.lang.Boolean, java.lang.Byte, java.lang.Character, java.lang.String, java.lang.Short, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Long, java.lang.Float, java.lang.Double, and java.lang.Class.

      Parameters:
      className - the fully-qualified class name of the entry type
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.1: Environment Entries

    • getClassName

      public String getClassName()
      Returns the fully-qualified Java type of this environment entry's value.
      Returns:
      the class name of the entry type

    • setValue

      public void setValue(String value)
      Sets the value of this environment entry. Corresponds to the env-entry-value element in the deployment descriptor.

      The value is specified as a string and will be converted to the type specified by setClassName(String).

      Parameters:
      value - the environment entry value as a string
      See Also:
      • Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 14.4.1: Environment Entries

    • getValue

      public String getValue()
      Returns the value of this environment entry.
      Returns:
      the environment entry value as a string
